title: Wine Vocabulary
description: Explore the language of wine tasting and viticulture with this vocabulary quiz

questions.question: In wine tasting, what does 'bouquet' refer to?
options: The vineyard where grapes were grown
The complex aromas that develop as wine ages

questions.question: What does 'tannin' refer to in wine?
options: A naturally occurring compound that creates a dry, puckering sensation in the mouth

questions.question: In wine terminology, what does 'terroir' mean?
options: The complete natural environment in which a wine is produced, including soil, climate, and terrain

questions.question: What does 'dry' mean when describing a wine?
options: The wine needs to be aerated
The wine contains little or no residual sugar

questions.question: What is 'decanting' in wine service?
options: Pouring wine from the bottle into another vessel to separate sediment and aerate it

questions.question: In wine terms, what does 'vintage' refer to?
options: The year in which the grapes were harvested

questions.question: What does 'full-bodied' mean when describing wine?
options: The wine is very dark in color
The wine has a rich, heavy, and complex feel in the mouth

questions.question: What is a 'sommelier'?
options: A trained wine professional who specializes in wine service

questions.question: In wine vocabulary, what does 'brut' mean on a champagne label?
options: Very dry, with little added sugar

questions.question: What does 'nose' refer to in wine tasting?
options: The overall smell or aroma of a wine
The shape of the bottle neck
The pointed end of a cork

questions.question: What is a 'varietal' wine?
options: A wine named after the dominant grape variety used to make it

questions.question: In wine terms, what does 'legs' or 'tears' refer to?
options: The streaks of wine that run down the inside of a glass after swirling

questions.question: What does 'corked' mean when describing a wine?
options: The wine is contaminated by a faulty cork, giving it a musty taste
The cork was difficult to remove
The wine has a cork closure

questions.question: What is 'malolactic fermentation' in winemaking?
options: The primary fermentation of grape juice
A secondary fermentation that converts sharp malic acid into softer lactic acid

questions.question: In wine vocabulary, what does 'finish' or 'aftertaste' refer to?
options: The end of the winemaking process
The last sip in the bottle
The flavors and sensations that linger after swallowing the wine
